events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle on the highway with significant rear-end damage.
Claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and vehicle details submitted.
An agent was assigned to manage the claim and coordinate with the customer for subsequent steps.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and informed the client about the next procedures.
The agent requested police reports, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates from the client.
Customer submitted all required documents including official accident report and photographs of the collision damage.
Investigation team began reviewing all submitted materials to confirm details and assess liability.
Investigation was completed successfully including verification of accident circumstances and vehicle damages.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer covering repair costs and rental vehicle expenses.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement offer and readiness to proceed with the approval.
The claim was officially approved by the claims department after customer acceptance of the settlement terms.
Payment was issued to the customer's designated account covering all approved repair and incidental costs.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation of payment receipt and resolution of all related matters.
